verses.verse: A Song <S%H7892><s%> of degrees <S%H4609><s%>. In my distress <S%H6869><s%> I cried <S%H7121><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, and he heard <S%H6030><s%> me.
Deliver <S%H5337><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%>, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, from lying <S%H8267><s%> lips <S%H8193><s%>, and from a deceitful <S%H7423><s%> tongue <S%H3956><s%>.
What shall be given <S%H5414><s%> unto thee? or what shall be done <S%H3254><s%> unto thee, thou false <S%H7423><s%> tongue <S%H3956><s%>?
Sharp <S%H8150><s%> arrows <S%H2671><s%> of the mighty <S%H1368><s%>, with coals <S%H1513><s%> of juniper <S%H7574><s%>.
Woe <S%H190><s%> is me, that I sojourn <S%H1481><s%> in Mesech <S%H4902><s%>, that I dwell <S%H7931><s%> in the tents <S%H168><s%> of Kedar <S%H6938><s%>!
My soul <S%H5315><s%> hath long <S%H7227><s%> dwelt <S%H7931><s%> with him that hateth <S%H8130><s%> peace <S%H7965><s%>.
I am for peace <S%H7965><s%>: but when I speak <S%H1696><s%>, they are for war <S%H4421><s%>.
